overview_of_class: This course introduces students to the analysis of the United States Congress. The subject matter covers many aspects of Congress - from congressional elections and redistricting, to the committee system, to political parties and polarization. We will also explore how pressures from the president and interest groups affect Congress. The course emphasizes how the goals of members, particularly reelection, shape the organization of the institution and the policies it produces.
name: Congress and the Legislative Process
title: WCAS POLI_SCI 325-0-20 Congress and the Legislative Process

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: This course introduces students to the analysis of the United States Congress. The subject matter covers many aspects of Congress - from congressional elections and redistricting, to the committee system, to political parties and polarization. We will also explore how pressures from the president and interest groups affect Congress. The course emphasizes how the goals of members, particularly reelection, shape the organization of the institution and the policies it produces.

descriptions.name: Registration Requirements
descriptions.value: Recommended (but not required) that students take PoliSci 220 (Intro to American Politics) or equivalent.

descriptions.name: Learning Objectives
descriptions.value:
(1) Critically reflect on how institutional rules affect congressional outcomes
(2) Analyze the impact of elections on legislative behavior
(3) Evaluate the role of parties in Congress
(4) Discuss and describe the problems facing the current Congress

descriptions.name: Evaluation Method
descriptions.value: Short Problem Set, Mid-Term Exam, Paper, Final Exam, Participation and Discussion

descriptions.name: Class Materials (Required)
descriptions.value: Davidson, Roger H., Walter J. Oleszek, Frances E. Lee, and Eric Schickler. 2015. Congress and its Members. 15th Edition. CQ Press. ISBN 978-1483388885
